steps.reasoning: Code execution starts from top and reaches console.log(A) wich is pushed to the Callstack
console.log(A) is a syncronous function so is executed inmediatly on the callstack giving an output of A on the console
Code execution reaches SetTimeout and is pushed to the main callstack
SetTimeout is an asyncronous function so is pushed to the web api thread releasing the main callstack and waits for 0s on the webapi thread
once time is passed the callback of SetTimeout is pushed to the macrotask queue
code execution reaches console.log(C) and push this function on the callstack
console.log(C) is a syncronous function so is executed inmediatly on the callstack giving an output of C on the console
once the main callstack is clean the macrotask queue push the callback on the main callstack wich is a console.log(B)
console.log(B) is a syncronous function so is executed inmediatly on the callstack giving an output of B on the console
